p: Additionally, an assay comparing cinnamon oil and cinnamaldehyde MIC values in the absence or presence of osmoprotectant (sorbitol or glycerol) was carried out ( Table 6). The assay was performed on two reference strains and two clinical isolates ( C. albicans 412 and C. glabrata 342, both isolated from Children’s Memorial Health Institute’s patients). MIC values for cinnamon oil and cinnamaldehyde were in the range 0.008–0.031% ( v/ v), while in the medium enriched with sorbitol these values decreased at least 4-fold, similar to the medium containing the added glycerol.
